code_value: I was at a wedding recently, and this woman comes up to me and says, "Oh, I hear you're in the Special Olympics!" "That's about the biggest insult you could say to me. The Special Olympics are for people with severe mental disabilities. They are held every year in every city, and everyone gets a hug and a ribbon at the end. The Paralympics aren't like that. We train year-round. It's very competitive — there's wheelchair basketball, fencing, powerlifting — it's not one of these disabled sports where people are like," "Oh, it's so good to see you out there. You just threw that on foot, and we're so glad!"
